pullRequest.body:
Another halfway split of #12381 on the way to #12352.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Filed #12850 and #12851 with the style tweaks I suggested. Reviews welcome - since *I* wrote these PRs, you should have no conflict of interest :-)
Michael, thank you very much for the continuing thorough reviews!
Thank you for writing this linter, Damiano - I would very much like to see it land!
Canceled.

bors merge

bors d+

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9059989459/job/24888756712)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Looks good to me: in a few places, I would tweak the code a little further (but these are minor comments).
Looks good to me: in a few places, I would tweak the code a little further (but these are minor comments).

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
I wouldn't mind the comment below this line getting translated (I speak some French, but not everybody does) - but this is pre-existing.
Translation provided!
For just reading the source, using `refine` would be quite clearer: AIUI, the `refine` creates two goals, the first of which is cdot-ed?
Done!  And indented the second one as well.

Can you use the `obtain ... := by exact ...` syntax here? (This instance was missed in #11045.)
Or would you prefer me filing a PR for this and few similar instances, which can land before this one?
Done!

I know you wanted to make minimal changes, but... I think that, like above, `refine` would make the source slightly clearer.

Would you prefer a separate PR with just this clean-up?
Done!
Again, `obtain ... := by ...` seems cleaner here.
Done!
I'm on the fence whether indenting both goals or just the first one is better. I don't strongly object to your current choice.
I ended up indenting this one as well!
